ratings.comment: I'm really not a huge fan of Chemistry, but Duncan's lectures at least tried to make the material more interesting and relevant. Make sure you read the text before coming to lecture or it won't make any sense. Review sessions are also a MUST! The exams are difficult especially the last one so do the practice problems and ask questions of your TA.

Tough class, GREAT guy. Went to a lot of office hours, very accessable and willing to help. Exams are pretty tough, and you definitely have to go above and beyond what he teaches in lecture. Lecture attendance is basically a must. TA was useless, probably could have pulled an AB with a decent one.

Tries to make lecture interesting, encourages participation, explains well. However he LOVES to pop balloons and often did so even when it was only barely relevant to the material. doesnt seem too keen on answering emails, but very helpful in office hours. study HARD for final.
I have never had a chemistry professor as good as Duncan.  The class is fun, fair, and he knows how to teach.

lectures could be hard to follow, it sometimes just seemed like a bunch of random ideas presented on different chalk boards.  I didn't find the homework/quizzes necessarily representative of info/depth of material covered in lecture
The man does his job and he does it well.  He keeps it light and relates to students.  His exams are tough if you don't put in the time but his lectures and review lectures are 100%.

Duncan is a really nice guy and occasionally had some funny jokes.  Lectures were ok, the other prof that taught it when I took it, Mahanthappa, was better but Duncan was good.  He held review sessions before each exam which were very helpful. The tests were the same as the other profs. They were pretty hard especially the final with ave high 60s .
Great sense of humor! Tests are pretty easy.

In my opinion, he is a great lecturer. He tries to be enthusiastic and make chemistry interesting and relevant to real world applications. I hated gen chem last semester but actually enjoyed it this sem.  Exams are very fair, not too difficult. I would definitely recommend him to anyone needing to take Chem.
HE IS REALLY NICE AND DOES A LOTTT OF DEMOS IN CLASS!!! EXPLOSIONS INCLUDED!!!!
The material covered is somewhat difficult, but he presents it well and is open to answer any questions that students may have.
The exams are pretty hard and the lecture is decent but not fabulous.Since he's a new lecturer,I can say that overall he's a good prof(he could be funny sometime)..=)
Duncan is a good guy. Expect to study hard. The exams aren't real easy, but there is nothing unexpected on them. There is usually around an 80 point curve in the class.

He is very easy to talk to, very approachable and super helpful when you go to him outside of lecture. The lectures pretty much reviewed all of the material you were supposed to have read but not in super great detail. Exams were somewhat difficult but were fair for an advanced class and shouldn't be an issue if you read the book. Well taught class

Duncans lectures are interesting but less than helpful. He reviews elementary ideas and expects you to extrapalate advanced material on your own. His exams arent really on what he lectures about and his TA's grade them harshly. He makes himself available but I found it was rarely helpful. If you get a good TA this class is good.

Not a helpful professor. His lectures were worthless. He taught at a high school level, while exams expected a comprehensive knowledge of the subject not presented in class or in the text. Not pleasant when asked for help. He offers regrading of tests, but leaves comments such as "you got more points than you deserved."

Very down to Earth professor.  If you attend lecture and put in the time to study yourself you can walk away with an AB no problem.  Expect to work on chemistry homework every night, even right after exams.  Exams are graded very strictly and they expect you to know everything. Overall great class and great professor.

Great Professor.  He'll sometimes make jokes about Republicans, which I found hilarious, but other than that his sense of humor is somewhat lacking.  Tests are not hard, but questions are sometimes worded badly.  TAs grade extremely strictly, but not the professor's fault.  Overall, great Prof.

Very good Prof. His exams were somewhat challenging at times but he was always there for questions and extra help if he was called upon by students. His lectures were pretty comprehensive and found it helpful to attend optional lectures on fridays.

a nice guy with a good sense of humor. apparently thought we were much smarter than we are (you had to BURN through those exams to finish), but it seemed he sincerely felt bad when the averages were in the 70's, since he gave extra credit (although i prefer curves myself). overall, a decent yet sometimes frustrating class

It was only his first year but he knows how to teach. He usually provides some awesome experiments during the lecture to keep you focussed. You almost always get an answer from him if you ask him anything by e-mail. Some questions on exams are pretty hard but most of them are fundamental and are from what he have discussed in the lecture. Great pro
This kid is legit. He was a great professor. His tests were fair and he is helpful when you email him. He has a good wardrobe...see if you can get the rainbow with his sweater selection.

This was his first year, but his exams were very difficult. Even with a 4x6 notecard on the exams, they are extremely difficult and most would agree that he tries to trick you. Luckily I had a great TA, otherwise I'm pretty sure I would not have survived in this class. If you want to save yourself some headaches, try to get a different prof.

at the beginning of the year he taught really slowly and was almost too easy.  he wasted lots of time and had to rush through material at the end and caused the entire class to fail the third midterm.  he doesnt allow graphing calculators but doesnt stop cheaters from using them on tests, creating unfair advantages for some. he wasnt very good.

i would actually recommend taking whitlock over duncan. his TAs write the quizzes, and since it was his first year we didnt have practice tests. get a good TA youre okay. but in all honestly, i found him rather annoying, especially all his emails. he'll prolly get better with time, but i wish i would have taken whitlock. would have gotten an A then

Well it's chem so the quizes and midterms are pretty difficult, but not any harder than you'd expect from any professor. He's very enthusiastic and charismatic in lecture and explains things very well.  Definitely, either Barry or Duncan your best choice for chem104
Quizzes can be difficult.  He's new so he often makes mistakes in lecture or has awkward silences when he's trying to figure out what to do next. Tests are so-so.
No Comments
